description: Retention of single-storey rear extension in a modified form ( finished in facing brick); external alterations to shop front involving installation of bifolding doors, canopies, decking and a balustrade; installation of a extraction flue at the rear;  and change of use from takeaway shop (A5 use class) to cafe/restaurant (A3 use class) to no. 5 (Retrospective Application)
decision_conditions: The retention of works to the frontage with out of keeping bifolding doors, canopies, timber decking and balustrades are detrimental to the character, and appearance of the subject Grade II listed building and Hanger Hill (Haymills) Estate Conservation Area, and are therefore contrary to the objectives of section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan and the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Estate Conservation Area Management Plan. | The retention of the rear extension due to the scale, materials and finishes, is not in keeping and detrimentally detracts from the character and appearance of the subject Grade II listed building, and Hanger Hill (Haymills) Estate Conservation Area, and is therefore contrary to the objectives of section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan and the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Estate Conservation Area Management Plan.
